lyrics.text: Lesson 7.
lyrics.translation: 第7课

lyrics.text: Mutilated Ladies.
lyrics.translation: 残破的女士们。

lyrics.text: Listen to the tape, then answer the question below.
lyrics.translation: 听录音，然后回答下面的问题。

lyrics.text: Why did Jane cook John's wallet?
lyrics.translation: 为什么简把约翰的钱包煮了？

lyrics.text: Has it ever happened to you?
lyrics.translation: 这在你身上发生过吗？

lyrics.text: Have you ever put your trousers in the washing machine and then remembered there was a large
lyrics.translation: 你有没有把裤子放进洗衣机里，然后突然想起里面有一张大

lyrics.text: banknote in your back pocket?
lyrics.translation: 你后口袋里有钞票吗？

lyrics.text: When you rescued your trousers, did you find the note was whiter than white?
lyrics.translation: 当你抢救你的裤子时，你有没有发现那张纸条比白还要白？

lyrics.text: People who live in Britain needn't despair when they make mistakes like this.
lyrics.translation: 生活在英国的人们在犯这样的错误时不必感到绝望。

lyrics.text: And a lot of people do.
lyrics.translation: 而且很多人确实如此。

lyrics.text: Fortunately for them, the Bank of England has a team called Mutilated Ladies, which
lyrics.translation: 幸运的是，英国银行有一个名为“残钞女郎”的团队，

lyrics.text: deals with claims from people who fed their money to a machine or to their dog.
lyrics.translation: 处理那些把钱喂给机器或狗的人的索赔。

lyrics.text: Dogs, it seems, love to chew up money.
lyrics.translation: 狗似乎喜欢把钱咬碎。

lyrics.text: A recent case concerns Jane Bucklin, whose fiance, John, runs a successful furniture
lyrics.translation: 最近有一个案例涉及到简·巴克林，她的未婚夫约翰经营着一家成功的家具店

lyrics.text: business.
lyrics.translation: 商业

lyrics.text: John had a very good day and put his wallet, containing 3,000 pounds, into the microwave
lyrics.translation: 约翰今天过得很好，他把装有3000英镑的钱包放进了微波炉。

lyrics.text: oven for safe keeping.
lyrics.translation: 安全保管的烤箱。

lyrics.text: Then he and Jane went horse riding.
lyrics.translation: 然后他和简去骑马了。

lyrics.text: When they got home, Jane cooked their dinner in the microwave oven and, without realizing
lyrics.translation: 当他们回到家时，简在微波炉里为他们准备晚餐，而没有意识到

lyrics.text: it, cooked her fiance's wallet as well.
lyrics.translation: 它，也煮熟了她未婚夫的钱包。

lyrics.text: Imagine their dismay when they found a beautifully cooked wallet and notes turned to ash.
lyrics.translation: 想象一下，当他们发现一个煮得很漂亮的钱夹和钞票变成了灰烬时，他们的失望。

lyrics.text: John went to see his bank manager, who sent the remains of the wallet and the money to
lyrics.translation: 约翰去见了他的银行经理，后者将钱包的残余部分和钱寄到了

lyrics.text: the Special Department of the Bank of England in Newcastle, the Mutilated Ladies.
lyrics.translation: 英格兰银行在纽卡斯尔的特别部门，残缺女士们。

lyrics.text: They examined the remains and John got all his money back.
lyrics.translation: 他们检查了残骸，约翰拿回了他的全部钱。

lyrics.text: So long as there's something to identify, we will give people their money back, said
lyrics.translation: 只要还有东西可以认领，我们就会把钱退给人们，他说

lyrics.text: a spokeswoman for the bank.
lyrics.translation: 银行的一位女发言人。

lyrics.text: Last year, we paid 1.5 million pounds on 21,000 claims.
lyrics.translation: 去年，我们为21,000项索赔支付了150万英镑。
